result.execSummary:
The defendant Gerald M Shoemaker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Rusk County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: DE will have a payment plan of $50.00 per month commencing 3-01-17 until paid in full.

The Court orders that if the defendant fails to pay the fine and costs within 60 days of the date of conviction or if the Court has authorized monthly payments for the fine and costs and they have not been paid, the Court will enter a judgment and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect this debt.  You must keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.
DE will provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gerald M Shoemaker

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DE has indicated he does not intend to seek PCR

Defendant Gerald M Shoemaker in court with attorney Stephanie E Thomas.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 16CM92.  Agreement has been reached in these matters, court recites agreement into the court record.  DE will enter a plea in 16CM88, 16CM92 will be DRI.  Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  DE Enters a plea of NC, court will accept and find the DE guilty.  Court will accept the recommendations of the parties.  DE will pay a fine of $10.00/CC, DNA sample and surcharge.  PP of $50.00 per month commencing 3-01-17 until paid in full.
Review hearing on November 29, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Bonds concurrent.  No contact with Rachel Valentine, if Embrace program completed bond will be amended to no abusive contact.  No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood. Each party shall contact Embrace and sign up for the Child exchange program.

Defendant Gerald M Shoemaker in court with attorney Stephanie E Thomas.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 16CM92.    Waive reading of the CC, enter plea of NG to misdemeanor counts.  $2500.00 sign bond, concurrent, no contact with Rachel Valentine, if Embrace program completed, bond will be amended to no abusive contact,   No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Each party shall contact Embrace and sign up for the Child exchange program.  Set for 11-29-16 @ 10:00 RH.
